refnamediv.refpurpose: Hierarchical signal mechanism for GNOME events.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The triggers API provides a way for applications to tell GNOME about interesting events that then cause something to happen (for example, playing a sound). An event can either be a function that is called, a sound that is played or an external command that is run.

Each trigger can optionally have a level associated with it and a section. The section is a list of strings that help to classify the event, which imposes a hierarchy on the trigger system. For example, messages about the hard drive partition /dev/hda1 may come under the section ("system", "device", "disk", "/dev/hda1"). This means that an application could trigger all events for the ("system", "device") sections and include those events, or be more specific and just trigger those for ("system", "device", "disk", "/dev/hda1").
At the present time, triggers are not widely used in GNOME, being mostly used to play sound events in response to certain actions.

refsect2.title: enum GnomeTriggerType
refsect2.para: These are the different types of triggers that can be activated by an application.

listitem.simpara: A null trigger type. Should never be used.
The trigger causes a function to be executed.
The trigger causes a command to be executed (using execv()).
The trigger causes a sound to be played.

refsect2.title: GnomeTriggerActionFunction ()
refsect2.para: The signature of a function that can used as a target for GTRIG_FUNCTION types of GnomeTrigger instances.

listitem.simpara: The human-readable message that was passed to gnome_triggers_do(). May be NULL.
The severity level of the event. May be NULL.
The section in which the event belongs. This is a NULL terminated array.

refsect2.title: GnomeTrigger
gnome_triggers_add_trigger ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new GnomeTrigger instance to the event hierarchy.

listitem.simpara: Information on the new trigger to be added.
The section to add the trigger under.

refsect2.title: gnome_triggers_vadd_trigger ()
refsect2.para: This does the same as gnome_triggers_add_trigger(), except the section is stored in the NULL terminated array supinfo instead of as a variable length argument list.

listitem.simpara: Information on the new trigger to be added.
The section to add the trigger under.

refsect2.title: gnome_triggers_do ()
refsect2.para: Notifies GNOME about an event happening, so that any appropriate handlers can be run.

listitem.simpara: The human-readable message describing the event (can be NULL).
The level of severity of the event, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gnome_triggers_vdo ()
refsect2.para: Notifies GNOME about an event happening, so that any appropriate handlers can be run. This does the same as gnome_trigger_do() except that it takes a NULL terminated array instead of a varargs list.

listitem.simpara: The human-readable message describing the event (can be NULL).
The level of severity of the event, or NULL.
The classification of the event (NULL terminated array).
